addressleaf.section:
To my L. T
re
r 20 De
c
1592

Belgia 1592 20 Decem
b
to My L Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please your good L. I have bin lately dis
q
eted w
t
a
painfull infirmitie, w
c
hath put me out of course of writing
to your L. but
e trueth is w
t
all,
t
e affaires of this c
o
trey have not
offered any mater. For every Province is at rest, and
e meeting
of
e
States
is adjorned for a moneth. There are diverse discoveries
made to
Co
u
t Maurice
for
e easie surprising of
e towne of
Bolduke
: and divers are imployed to take a dilig
e
t information
of every intelligence:
t
if in
e trial they prove to be true, some
attempt may be given. In
e Enemies c
o
trey, sins
e death
of
e
D. of Parma
, there hath no m
a
undertak
e
to c
o
mand in his
place. It is thought
e generallitie doeth affect
e
Count
Mansfelde
: but yet
e
Councel of Estate
doth give all dire-
ctions: though
e Spaniard, as they say, will be subject to
neither. For w
c
e order of
e
King
is expected out of
Spaine.
It hath pleased her
M
tie
of late, to have a gratious
considerati
o
of my private estate, and of my long being
heere, and to cause my
L
a
of Warwicke
and
M
r
Vicechamberlaine
to give me notice of her pleasure, That wh
e
Christmas
is past, I shall have licence to returne. Whether it
be
t
your L. being then fr
o
e Court, have intelligence
of it sins, I am wholy uncertaine: but because I
a
assured,
t
I shall not be discharged, unles your L. will vouchsafe
to be a meane
t
my licence may be signed by her Hig
es
I am
therfore to beseeche you w
t
all dutifull humblenes,
t
it may
stand w
t
your good liking, to favour me therein. For w
c
I can
not be more bound, then I am already to your L. but it will
serve me in
e co
u
t of your honorable favours for a singular
accesse.
And so w
t
hope in
t
behalfe of your confortable
aunswear, I take my humble leave. From
e Hage.
De
c
20 1592.
